snippet: Mr. Gilbert, who won the National Book Critics Circle Award in 2005 for “Refusing Heaven,” was a peculiar figure in the contemporary poetry world in the sense that he wasn’t exactly in it.
abstract: Jack Gilbert, writer of forthright and emotionally fraught poetry, dies at age 87.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Gilbert, who won the National Book Critics Circle Award in 2005 for “Refusing Heaven,” was a peculiar figure in the contemporary poetry world in the sense that he wasn’t exactly in it.

headline.seo: Jack Gilbert, a Poet Off the Literary Grid, Dies at 87
headline.main: Jack Gilbert, a Poet Whose Words Transformed Lives, Is Dead at 87
headline.print_headline: Jack Gilbert, a Poet Whose Words Transformed Lives, Is Dead at 87
